close_symbols: custom_error_log (member declaration / function-pointer typedef or prototype)
explanation:
Provide the listed symbols so the analyzer can determine whether any compiler/language extensions are used by MHD_DLOG: 
- struct MHD_Daemon (complete definition): needed to see the exact declarations of members options, custom_error_log and custom_error_log_cls. A non‑standard member declaration (e.g. use of GCC attributes, nonportable calling conventions, nested functions, or other extensions) would be visible only here. 
- MHD_USE_ERROR_LOG (macro definition): the macro could expand to an expression that uses compiler extensions (typeof, statement expressions ({ ... }), builtins, etc.). Inspecting its definition is required to rule that out. 
- custom_error_log (member declaration / function‑pointer typedef or prototype): crucial to check whether the function pointer type uses any compiler extensions (attributes like __attribute__((format(...))), nonstandard calling conventions, variadic prototype, or other extensions). Also required to verify that passing a va_list is type‑correct (i.e. the callee expects va_list vs ...). 
- custom_error_log_cls (member type / declaration): to confirm its type and any attributes or extensions attached to the stored context parameter. 
- va_list, va_start, va_end (stdarg.h definitions/macros): although part of the standard library, the actual platform headers may implement these macros/types using compiler extensions; inspect their definitions if you must verify absence of language extensions (or nonstandard implementations).
